qas.question: In which year was West Germany admitted to NATO?
Halvard Lange was a minister of which NATO member?
Who ended WWII in Europe by defeating the Allies?

plausible_answers.text: the admission of the Federal Republic of Germany to the North Atlantic Pact

qas.question: East Germany was accepted to the North Atlantic Pact on what date?
Who was Foreign Affairs Minister of Germany in 1955?
Who requested a new European Security Treaty in April 1954?

context: On 23 October <a0_0>1954<a0_0/> – only nine years after Allies (UK, USA and USSR) defeated <b2_0>Nazi Germany<b2_0/> ending World War II in Europe – <b3_0>the admission of the Federal Republic of Germany to the North Atlantic Pact<b3_0/> was finally decided. The incorporation of West Germany into the organization on <b4_0>9 May 1955<b4_0/> was described as "a decisive turning point in the history of our continent" by <b5_0>Halvard Lange<b5_0/>, Foreign Affairs Minister of <a1_0>Norway<a1_0/> at the time. In November 1954, the <b6_0>USSR<b6_0/> requested a new European Security Treaty, in order to make a final attempt to not have a remilitarized West Germany potentially opposed to the Soviet Union, with no success.
